item.title: Cryptopals - Set 1 Challenge 5: Implement repeating-key XOR
item.description: An explanation of how to implement repeating-key XOR.

item.title: Cryptopals - Set 1 Challenge 4: Detect single-character XOR
item.description: An explanation of how to detect single-character XOR.

item.title: Cryptopals - Set 1 Challenge 3: Single-byte XOR Cipher
item.description: An explanation of how to decrypt single-byte XOR in Go.

item.title: Cryptopals - Set 1 Challenge 2: Fixed XOR
item.description: An explanation of how to implement fixed XOR in Go.

item.title: Cryptopals - Set 1 Challenge 1: Convert hex to base64
item.description: An explanation of how to convert hex to base64, with a programmatic solution in Go.

item.title: Pkgsite Search Redesign
item.description: The search experience on pkg.go.dev has been updated! Package search results are now grouped by module, and you can now search for symbols.

item.title: Redirecting godoc.org requests to pkg.go.dev
item.description: Requests to godoc.org will redirect to pkg.go.dev in early 2021. This blog post discusses the plans for that migration.

item.title: Pkg.go.dev has a new look!
item.description: The package pages on pkg.go.dev have been redesigned to make the relationship between packages, modules and directories more intuitive and easier to explore.

item.title: Pkg.go.dev is open source!
item.description: The codebase for pkg.go.dev is now open source! Check it out at golang.org/x/pkgsite, and learn how to contribute to the project.

item.title: Next steps for pkg.go.dev
item.description: Now that pkg.go.dev has launched, what’s next? We have received a lot of helpful user feedback, and here’s our plans to improve pkg.go.dev in 2020.

item.title: Go.dev: a new hub for Go developers
item.description: Introducing go.dev and pkg.go.dev, a new hub for Go developers.
